venue.name: Outside of Gate 1 (main entrance) of the Charlestown Navy Yard

item.description:
Charlestown was the first capital of the Massachusetts Bay Colony before the Puritans crossed over to Boston in 1630.  In 1775, Paul Revere crossed over to Charlestown to begin his famous Midnight Ride, the colonists stood up to the British army at the Battle of Bunker Hill, and Charlestown was burned to the ground.

Tour this urban village founded in 1628 ane learn of the early Puritan settlement, the Bunker Hill monument, and many of its distinguished citizens which have included John Harvard and Samuel Morse.

Despite its recent fame as a bank robber haven in The Town, Charlestown has a complex history and is continuing to evolve as more people discover small the town where Boston began.

Rain or shine; no reservations necessary. Admission: $12; $5 BBF members.

item.name: Charlestown: Where Boston Began
